userreviews.userReview: Matters of the heart focuses on changing the hearts and minds of saved and unsaved individuals. It addresses the fact that many who call themselves christians are living a life contrary to the life that God wants them to live. Many are caught up in the politics of religion yet have no real relationship with god. Jaunita breaks down the philosophy of what it is to be saved and receive a new heart and what we can do about it.Quotes...."You are maturing when you are the first to apologize, the first to keep the peace, when you are the first to say ' What did i do wrong?' rather than nailing the other person to the wall for what they did.""if you do not have a real relationship with Him, then you merely 'appreciate' Him for the life and breath that He has given you. You are grateful for the way He makes for you out of no way and for all the things he permits you to have. but you are still operating from a materialistic standpoint -- and that is not real love. it cannot become real until you become committed and submitted to his ways.""when you start doing ungodly things and yet try to justify why you are doing it, your moral understanding is darkened, and your reasoning is beclouded.""Transformation takes place when our minds are brought to the understanding that we need God."

The book breaks your heart down one compartment at a time. She gives direct correlation from your heart, brain and manifestation! It will change your thinking, and if God can change your mind, your heart will surely follow!

Knowing the stuff that is in your heart (which God said, out of the heart- flows the issues of life). You will be surprised that our heart and desperate and wicked above all (the Bible says it is). Read/listen how Dr. Bynum can help you to know the matters within our heart that need fixing...

So far this book has been really helpful to me and my walk with God. I have been able to find myself within the first couple of chapter with areas I been having problems with. Juanita Bynum is a powergul woman of God. I love reading her books because while being looked down upon by critics, she still continues to tell the TRUTH. She puts her whole being into her books and doesn't care what anyone has to say about it. I will continue to read her old and newly coming books because they continue to amaze me with the Hell that she went through, but through it all, she was able to overcome her struggles!

I love this book!! Juanita talks about how physically the heart is developed within our bodies from birth. Then she compares how the heart is developed to the way we live our lives daily. Please keep Juanita in your prayers!!
Very inspirational book. Totally what I needed to read during a difficutl time in my life.
God will heal the heart, but we have to be willing to change. I read this during a time of complete emotional upheaval and savored every word
I love it, I love Juanita
This only got 4 stars because I kept starting and stopping this. You be the judge.
Just what I need at the time I needed. Great read if you desire to grow in the Lord

description: God began to deal with me...As the tears rolled down my face, God said, You are thinking like a man. You are always concerned about the outward appearance...but what is the condition of your heart toward Me and toward My people? I sat there confused and said to the Lord, 'MY HEART?'... This groundbreaking message will open your eyes to the truth about your own heart. Whether you are new to the faith or have been doing great things for God's kingdom for years, you still need a new heart. This Word from the Lord has changed Juanita Bynum's life, and it will change yours as well! Find out how you can be doing good works for God and not even know Him as you should. Uncover areas where your old heart deceived you, and learn why it can't be fixed. Explore the heart/mind connection and see why this key to intimacy with God is so vital to a healthy, satisfying and effective life. God wants to do some major heart surgery and give you a permanent and improved life. Are you ready to receive?
title: Matters of the Heart
